result.execSummary:
The defendant John A. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:02 am - DA calls cases 15CF64 and 16CM61 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant John A. Peterson appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information previously filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.   DA certifies victims right compliance.  Court orders amendment of 16CM61 to dc, an ordinance violation.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to amended charge. Court finds DE guilty and orders fine of $295.  60 days to pay or CO.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to 15CF64.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO. Court imposes:

15CF64 - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine
$250 DNAAS
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.
5 days jail with huber and is to commence within 30 days of 3/28/17 with continued obedience to bond.  Jail may be served on weekends with approval of probation agent and may be served in any county.
Obtain high school diploma or equivalent
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

DE advised of loss of rights due to felony conviction.

Contraband to be destroyed after appeal time has expired

Appeal rights given
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on November 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant John A. Peterson in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Information has been filed, acknowleged and reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Arraignment on July 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Motion to Suppress Statements
Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence
Waiver of preliminary examination

3:02 pm - Defendant John A. Peterson appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions DE regarding waiver of preliminary examination form. Court finds waiver to be free.  Parties have received and reviewed information and waive reading. Bond to continue. Adj. 3:04 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant John A. Peterson appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond to continue.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. Case called, appearances and possible charges stated. Defendant's next court date is 12-1-15 at 10:00 am. Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
